simple Class

Defined in: lib/api/simple.js:2
Module: simple
Parent Module: arango

The api module to do perform simple queries in ArangoDB.

  • Methods

(
  • [collection]
  • example
  • [options]
  • callback
)
Promise

Defined in lib/api/simple.js:64

This will find all documents matching a given example.

Parameters:

  • [collection] String optional
    • The collection containing the documents.If not provided the collection defined in the connection is used.
  • example Object
    • An object defining the example.
  • [options] Object optional
    • JSONObject with optional parameters:
    • [skip] Number optional
      • can also be set using the "skip" method in this class.
    • [limit] Number optional
      • can also be set using the "limit" method in this class
  • callback Function
    • The callback function.

Promise:

first

(
  • [collection]
  • [count=1]
  • callback
)
Promise

Defined in lib/api/simple.js:258

This will return the first documents from the collection, in the order of insertion/update time. When the count argument is supplied, the result will be a list of documents, with the "oldest" document being first in the result list. If the count argument is not supplied, the result is the "oldest" document of the collection, or null if the collection is empty.

Parameters:

  • [collection] String optional
    • The collection containing the documents.If not provided the collection defined in the connection is used.
  • [count=1] Number optional
    • the number of documents to return at most.
  • callback Function
    • The callback function.

Returns:

Promise:

fulltext

(
  • [collection]
  • attribute
  • query
  • [options]
  • callback
)
Promise

Defined in lib/api/simple.js:471

This will find all documents from the collection that match the fulltext query specified in query. In order to use the fulltext operator, a fulltext index must be defined for the collection and the specified attribute.

Parameters:

  • [collection] String optional
    • The collection containing the documents.If not provided the collection defined in the connection is used.
  • attribute String
    • the attribute
  • query String
    • the query
  • [options] Object optional
    • JSONObject with optional parameters:
    • [skip] Number optional
      • can also be set using the "skip" method in this class.
    • [limit] Number optional
      • can also be set using the "limit" method in this class
    • [index] Number optional
      • If given, the identifier of the fulltext-index to use.
  • callback Function
    • The callback function.

Returns:

Promise:

last

(
  • [collection]
  • [count=1]
  • callback
)
Promise

Defined in lib/api/simple.js:295

This will return the last documents from the collection, in the order of insertion/update time. When the count argument is supplied, the result will be a list of documents, with the "newest" document being first in the result list. If the count argument is not supplied, the result is the "newest" document of the collection, or null if the collection is empty.

Parameters:

  • [collection] String optional
    • The collection containing the documents.If not provided the collection defined in the connection is used.
  • [count=1] Number optional
    • the number of documents to return at most.
  • callback Function
    • The callback function.

Returns:

Promise:

near

(
  • [collection]
  • latitude
  • longitude
  • [options]
  • callback
)
Promise

Defined in lib/api/simple.js:378

The default will find at most 100 documents near a given coordinate. The returned list is sorted according to the distance, with the nearest document coming first. If there are near documents of equal distance, documents are chosen randomly from this set until the limit is reached. In order to use the near operator, a geo index must be defined for the collection. This index also defines which attribute holds the coordinates for the document. If you have more then one geo-spatial index, you can use the geo field to select a particular index.

Parameters:

  • [collection] String optional
    • The collection containing the documents.If not provided the collection defined in the connection is used.
  • latitude Number
    • The latitude of the coordinate.
  • longitude Number
    • The longitude of the coordinate.
  • [options] Object optional
    • JSONObject with optional parameters:
    • [skip] Number optional
      • can also be set using the "skip" method in this class.
    • [limit] Number optional
      • can also be set using the "limit" method in this class
    • [geo] Number optional
      • If given, the identifier of the geo-index to use.
    • [distance] Number optional
      • If given, the attribute key used to store the distance.
  • callback Function
    • The callback function.

Returns:

Promise:

range

(
  • [collection]
  • attribute
  • left
  • right
  • [options]
  • callback
)
Promise

Defined in lib/api/simple.js:331

This will find all documents within a given range. You must declare a skip-list index on the attribute in order to be able to use a range query.

Parameters:

  • [collection] String optional
    • The collection containing the documents.If not provided the collection defined in the connection is used.
  • attribute String
    • the attribute path to check.
  • left Number | String
    • The lower bound.
  • right Number | String
    • The upper bound.
  • [options] Object optional
    • JSONObject with optional parameters:
    • [skip] Number optional
      • can also be set using the "skip" method in this class.
    • [limit] Number optional
      • can also be set using the "limit" method in this class
    • [closed=false] Number optional
      • If true, use interval including left and right, otherwise exclude right, but include left.
  • callback Function
    • The callback function.

Returns:

Promise:

removeByExample

(
  • [collection]
  • example
  • [options]
  • callback
)
Promise

Defined in lib/api/simple.js:99

This will remove all documents matching a given example.

Parameters:

  • [collection] String optional
    • The collection containing the documents.If not provided the collection defined in the connection is used.
  • example Object
    • An object defining the example.
  • [options] Object optional
    • JSONObject with optional parameters:
    • [waitForSync] Boolean optional
      • if set to true, then all removal operations will instantly be synchronised to disk. If this is not specified, then the collection's default sync behavior will be applied.
    • [limit] Number optional
      • can also be set using the "limit" method in this class
  • callback Function
    • The callback function.

Returns:

Promise:

replaceByExample

(
  • [collection]
  • example
  • newValue
  • [options]
  • callback
)
Promise

Defined in lib/api/simple.js:135

This will find all documents in the collection that match the specified example object, and replace the entire document body with the new value specified. Note that document meta-attributes such as _id, _key, _from, _to etc. cannot be replaced.

Parameters:

  • [collection] String optional
    • The collection containing the documents.If not provided the collection defined in the connection is used.
  • example Object
    • An object defining the example.
  • newValue Object
    • The replacement object.
  • [options] Object optional
    • JSONObject with optional parameters:
    • [waitForSync] Boolean optional
      • if set to true, then all removal operations will instantly be synchronised to disk. If this is not specified, then the collection's default sync behavior will be applied.
    • [limit] Number optional
      • can also be set using the "limit" method in this class
  • callback Function
    • The callback function.

Returns:

Promise:

updateByExample

(
  • [collection]
  • example
  • newValue
  • [options]
  • callback
)
Promise

Defined in lib/api/simple.js:178

This will find all documents in the collection that match the specified example object, and partially update the document body with the new value specified. Note that document meta-attributes such as _id, _key, _from, _to etc. cannot be replaced.

Parameters:

  • [collection] String optional
    • The collection containing the documents.If not provided the collection defined in the connection is used.
  • example Object
    • An object defining the example.
  • newValue Object
    • The replacement object.
  • [options] Object optional
    • JSONObject with optional parameters:
    • [waitForSync] Boolean optional
      • if set to true, then all removal operations will instantly be synchronised to disk. If this is not specified, then the collection's default sync behavior will be applied.
    • [limit] Number optional
      • can also be set using the "limit" method in this class
    • [keepNull=true] Boolean optional
      • "false" will remove null values from the update document.
  • callback Function
    • The callback function.

Returns:

Promise:

within

(
  • [collection]
  • latitude
  • longitude
  • radius
  • [options]
  • callback
)
Promise

Defined in lib/api/simple.js:423

This will find all documents with in a given radius around the coordinate (latitude, longitude). The returned list is sorted by distance. In order to use the near operator, a geo index must be defined for the collection. This index also defines which attribute holds the coordinates for the document. If you have more then one geo-spatial index, you can use the geo field to select a particular index.

Parameters:

  • [collection] String optional
    • The collection containing the documents.If not provided the collection defined in the connection is used.
  • latitude Number
    • The latitude of the coordinate.
  • longitude Number
    • The longitude of the coordinate.
  • radius Number
    • The radius in meters.
  • [options] Object optional
    • JSONObject with optional parameters:
    • [skip] Number optional
      • can also be set using the "skip" method in this class.
    • [limit] Number optional
      • can also be set using the "limit" method in this class
    • [geo] Number optional
      • If given, the identifier of the geo-index to use.
    • [distance] Number optional
      • If given, the attribute key used to store the distance.
  • callback Function
    • The callback function.

Returns:

Promise:
